title: Authors and Citation
text: Rustler M, Sonnenberg H (2023). kwb.nextcloud: R Package Accessing Nextcloud Using WebDAV API. R package version 0.3.0.9000, https://github.com/KWB-R/kwb.nextcloud.
code: @Manual{,   title = {kwb.nextcloud: R Package for Accessing Nextcloud Using WebDAV API},   author = {Michael Rustler and Hauke Sonnenberg},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.3.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/KWB-R/kwb.nextcloud}, }

title: R Package for Accessing Nextcloud Using WebDAV API
text: installing latest release R package run following code :
code: # Enable repository from kwb-r options(repos = c(   kwbr = 'https://kwb-r.r-universe.dev',   CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))    # Download and install kwb.nextcloud in R install.packages('kwb.nextcloud')  # Browse the kwb.nextcloud manual pages help(package = 'kwb.nextcloud')

what: Backup a Cloud Folder to a Local Zip File — backup_cloud_folder
title: Backup a Cloud Folder to a Local Zip File — backup_cloud_folder
text: Zip cloud folder download local zip file. Default file name: <backup_dir>/cloud-backup_<base_name>_<yyyy-mm-dd-HHMM>.zip

title: Backup a Cloud Folder to a Local Zip File — backup_cloud_folder
code: backup_cloud_folder(   path,   target_file = get_download_target_file(base_name, backup_dir),   user = nextcloud_user(),   auth = nextcloud_auth(),   backup_dir = kwb.utils::createDirectory("~/../Downloads/nextcloud-backups"),   base_name = basename(path) )

title: Backup a Cloud Folder to a Local Zip File — backup_cloud_folder
text: path path folder cloud target_file path target file. default path provided get_download_target_file(base_name, backup_dir) user user name, default taken environment variable "NEXTCLOUD_USER". auth authentication header provided kwb.nextcloud:::nextcloud_auth backup_dir directory download zip-file base_name base name integrated name downloaded file

what: Compare Two Files Containing File Information — compare_file_info_files
title: Compare Two Files Containing File Information — compare_file_info_files
text: Compare two CSV files retrieved list_files(..., full_info = TRUE)

title: Compare Two Files Containing File Information — compare_file_info_files
Compare Two Files Containing File Information — compare_file_info_files
text: file_1 path first csv file file_2 path second csv file ... arguments passed read.csv2

what: Create a Folder on the Cloud — create_folder
title: Create a Folder on the Cloud — create_folder
text: Create Folder Cloud

title: Create a Folder on the Cloud — create_folder
Create a Folder on the Cloud — create_folder
text: path path folder created user user name, default taken environment variable "NEXTCLOUD_USER". auth authentication header provided kwb.nextcloud:::nextcloud_auth

what: Delete a File or Folder on the Cloud — delete_file_or_folder
title: Delete a File or Folder on the Cloud — delete_file_or_folder
text: Delete File Folder Cloud

title: Delete a File or Folder on the Cloud — delete_file_or_folder
code: delete_file_or_folder(   path,   user = nextcloud_user(),   auth = nextcloud_auth(),   ... )

title: Delete a File or Folder on the Cloud — delete_file_or_folder
text: path path file folder deleted user user name, default taken environment variable "NEXTCLOUD_USER". auth authentication header provided kwb.nextcloud:::nextcloud_auth ... arguments passed kwb.nextcloud:::nextcloud_request

title: Download Files from Cloud — download_files
text: Download Files Cloud

title: Download Files from Cloud — download_files
code: download_files(   hrefs = NULL,   target_dir = create_download_dir("nextcloud_", dbg = dbg),   paths = NULL,   user = nextcloud_user(),   auth = nextcloud_auth(),   dbg = TRUE )

title: Download Files from Cloud — download_files
text: hrefs href strings specifying files downloaded. href strings returned list_files. Alternatively, paths files can given paths. target_dir path local target directory paths Alternatively givin href strings, paths files can given argument. user name nextcloud user. Default: result calling kwb.nextcloud:::nextcloud_user auth authentication returned kwb.nextcloud:::nextcloud_user dbg logical indicating whether show debug messages

title: Does a File Exist on the Nextcloud Server? — file_exists
text: File Exist Nextcloud Server?

title: Does a File Exist on the Nextcloud Server? — file_exists
Does a File Exist on the Nextcloud Server? — file_exists
text: path path file

title: Does a File Exist on the Nextcloud Server? — file_exists
text: TRUE file exists, else FALSE

what: Get Version Information on Files of Given IDs — get_version_info
title: Get Version Information on Files of Given IDs — get_version_info
text: Get Version Information Files Given IDs

title: Get Version Information on Files of Given IDs — get_version_info
Get Version Information on Files of Given IDs — get_version_info
text: file_ids vector integer representing file ids (values returned column fileid) list_files user nextcloud user ignore pattern matching columns excluded result. Set NULL see columns available.

title: Get Version Information on Files of Given IDs — get_version_info
text: data frame one row per version. seems entry corresponding file one version.

what: List the Partner's File Versions (Except Current) — list_file_versions
title: List the Partner's File Versions (Except Current) — list_file_versions
text: List Partner's File Versions (Except Current)

title: List the Partner's File Versions (Except Current) — list_file_versions
List the Partner's File Versions (Except Current) — list_file_versions
text: path relative path folder file versions listed pattern optional. specified, files names matching pattern considered. ... additional arguments passed list_files, recursive, max_depth

what: List Files on the Nextcloud Server — list_files
title: List Files on the Nextcloud Server — list_files
text: List Files Nextcloud Server

title: List Files on the Nextcloud Server — list_files
code: list_files(   path = "",   pattern = NULL,   recursive = FALSE,   full_info = FALSE,   user = nextcloud_user(),   auth = nextcloud_auth(),   max_depth = NA,   ... )

title: List Files on the Nextcloud Server — list_files
text: path path nextcloud folder listed pattern optional regular expression. file names match regular expression returned. recursive TRUE contents subfolders listed well, given max_depth. full_info TRUE full file information returned data frame. FALSE (default) (relative) file paths returned vector character. user user name, default taken environment variable "NEXTCLOUD_USER". auth authentication header provided kwb.nextcloud:::nextcloud_auth max_depth maximum recursion depth recursive = TRUE. default max_depth NA meaning function behaves "fully recursive". ... arguments passed kwb.nextcloud:::list_cloud_files, silent = TRUE

title: List Files on the Nextcloud Server — list_files
text: vector character data frame, attribute "root" set value path.

what: Move a File or Folder on the Cloud — move_file_or_folder
title: Move a File or Folder on the Cloud — move_file_or_folder
text: Move File Folder Cloud

title: Move a File or Folder on the Cloud — move_file_or_folder
code: move_file_or_folder(   path,   path_target,   overwrite = FALSE,   user = nextcloud_user(),   auth = nextcloud_auth(),   dbg = TRUE,   ... )

title: Move a File or Folder on the Cloud — move_file_or_folder
text: path path file folder moved path_target path target file folder moved overwrite whether overwrite file folder case file folder already exists (default: FALSE) user user name, default taken environment variable "NEXTCLOUD_USER". auth authentication header provided kwb.nextcloud:::nextcloud_auth dbg print debug messages (default: TRUE) ... arguments passed kwb.nextcloud:::nextcloud_request

title: Move a File or Folder on the Cloud — move_file_or_folder
text: return path_target moved file/folder

what: Convert Path to href as Required for Download — path_to_file_href
title: Convert Path to href as Required for Download — path_to_file_href
text: Convert Path href Required Download

title: Convert Path to href as Required for Download — path_to_file_href
Convert Path to href as Required for Download — path_to_file_href
text: path path file Nextcloud server user name Nextcloud user, default: kwb.nextcloud:::nextcloud_user() leading_slash returned href start slash?

what: Upload a Local File to the Cloud — upload_file
title: Upload a Local File to the Cloud — upload_file
text: Upload Local File Cloud

title: Upload a Local File to the Cloud — upload_file
code: upload_file(   file,   target_path = "documents",   user = nextcloud_user(),   auth = nextcloud_auth() )

title: Upload a Local File to the Cloud — upload_file
text: file path local file target_path path folder cloud upload file user user name, default taken environment variable "NEXTCLOUD_USER". auth authentication header provided kwb.nextcloud:::nextcloud_auth

title: kwb.nextcloud 0.3.0 2021-06-03
text: Add move_file_or_folder(): see Moving files folders Fix remove leading slashes internal function path_to_file_href()

title: kwb.nextcloud 0.2.0 2021-04-01
text: Fix bug list_files(): endless recursion (#32) Add compare_file_info_files() (R package kwb.budget) CI: move Travis Appveyor Github actions (#35)

title: kwb.nextcloud 0.1.0 2020-06-04
text: Exported functions: create_folder() delete_file_or_folder(), TAKE CARE! download_files() get_version_info() list_files() upload_file()

title: kwb.nextcloud 0.0.0.9000
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. see https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html writing good NEWS.md
